thread.title_full: NBA GMs name Marc Gasol best center, Tony Allen toughest player

author: Ronald Tillery
title: NBA GMs name Marc Gasol best center, Tony Allen toughest player
text:
Add a few more people who believe Grizzlies center Marc Gasol is poised to have an encore season.
With 65.5 percent of the vote, Gasol was selected as the best center in the NBA’s annual survey by general managers .
The GMs responded to 49 different questions (including a few new ones) about the best teams, players, coaches, fans, and offseason moves. General managers were not permitted to vote for their own team or personnel. Percentages are based on the pool of respondents to that particular question, rather than all 30 GMs.
Gasol also picked up the nod as the league’s best interior defender ahead of Anthony Davis (New Orleans) and DeAndre Jordan (Los Angeles Clippers). And for just the second time since Dirk Nowitzki has played in the NBA, league general managers named someone else as the best among international players.
Gasol received 62.1 percent of the vote in that category.
Veteran swingman Tony Allen checked in as the toughest player in the NBA for a second straight season with 20.7 percent of the vote. Golden State’s Draymond Green finished second while Griz forward Zach Randolph tied Kobe Bryant and Jimmy Butler for third place with 6.9 percent.
Allen finished fourth for best defensive player in the NBA. Davis, LeBron James (Cleveland) and Kawhi Leonard (San Antonio) ranked ahead of Allen.
As for perimeter defenders, Allen placed second behind Leonard.
Memphis came in second behind Golden State for best defensive team. Griz coach Dave Joerger finished second behind San Antonio’s Gregg Popovich as the coach with the best defensive schemes.
The GMs ranked the Grizzlies sixth among Western Conference teams behind Houston, the Los Angeles Clippers, Oklahoma, San Antonio and Golden State.
Mike Conley received the only other Griz mention. He ranked fourth among the best point guards in the league and received votes for player most likely to have a breakout season. Russell Westbrook, Chris Paul and Stephen Curry ranked ahead of Conley in the category of best point guards.
The GMs also said Conley would make the second-best future NBA head coach someday. They rated Paul No. 1 in that category.
